mods.abstract: $25 TO $100 REWARD!! RANAWAY from the subscriber, at Lacal's Hotel two slaves, EDWARD and his wife LILA, for whose apprehension and delivery to me, before my departure from Natchitoches, I will give $25. If taken after my departure, I will give the sum of $50, for their safe delivery in any jail; or $100 for their delivery to me at Mansfield, DeSoto Parish. DESCRIPTION:--Edward is a Mulatto with long straight hair, of Indian or Mexican appearance, about 5 feet 6 or 7 inches in height, and inclined to be stout. The woman is a Mulattress, about 20 years of age, and is genteely dressed. They are believed to be making their way to the Mississippi River. D. Creswell sep 28-4t
mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )
mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
